title: So this is Zaun?
body:
http://www.lol-wallpapers.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Zaun-5-League-of-Legends-Artwork-Wallpaper-lol.jpg

It actually has a bit of a regal feel to it. I'm happy its more than just green chemicals and air pollution.

replies.body:
We've known to an extent what Zaun's looked like for a while due to the Camille comics, Ekko comics and video, and Warwick video.

It's supposed to be the lower half of Piltover, so it's basically just a run down part of Piltover. The original Piltover, taken over by crime lords and industry. 
While the upper half is in the sky, mostly safe from the pollution and scum down below, it's the same city.

> [{quoted}](name=SulkingKING,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=MdajWHIW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-08-02T02:14:45.250+0000)
>
> We've known to an extent what Zaun's looked like for a while due to the Camille comics, Ekko comics and video, and Warwick video.
> 
> It's supposed to be the lower half of Piltover, so it's basically just a run down part of Piltover. The original Piltover, taken over by crime lords and industry. 
> While the upper half is in the sky, mostly safe from the pollution and scum down below, it's the same city.

I like to think of Piltover and Zaun being like some cities that have a new town and an old town district.  

Edinburgh, for example, has the 'old town' area near the castle - with narrow streets, ancient buildings, and some beautiful architecture from hundreds of years ago.  Its new town area, on the other hand, has wide open plazas, tall pale-stone buildings, with a certain amount of formality and order.  (To be clear, this 'new town' was built around 1800, so 'new' is relative.)

Zaun is the original - Piltover is the new.  Both have their beauty - whether it's the beauty of history and variety, or the beauty of the new and the ordered.  (Though, the beauty of Zaun now lies under a layer of grime and enrobed in the Gray.)

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=MdajWHIW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-08-02T15:09:13.016+0000)Zaun is the original - Piltover is the new.  Both have their beauty - whether it's the beauty of history and variety, or the beauty of the new and the ordered.  (Though, the beauty of Zaun now lies under a layer of grime and enrobed in the Gray.)

This begs an interesting question.

Since Zaun is largely subterranean, *why* was a city -- let alone one at such a strategic location -- built in such an inconvenient manner and location as inside a canyon? If anything I'd have expected to see Piltover be the original, and spread downward as the population grew (pushing the less wealthy individuals lower and lower as time passed).

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=MdajWHIW,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-08-02T17:42:22.296+0000)

If anything I'd have expected to see Piltover be the original, and spread downward as the population grew (pushing the less wealthy individuals lower and lower as time passed).

It wasn't in the canyon originally - the canyons are relatively new.  Since the creation of the Sun Gates.

Ahhh. Got it. I missed that bit of the lore somewhere along the way. Zaun seems to have held up pretty well through that upheaval though!
So are they just one big city seperated by an unspoken line? If so i would love to see the new map be zaun vs piltover
Im very curious, is there some other reason behind pointing this out or are you so naive that its taken you what 2-3 years before noticing something so obvious about Zaun?
